title: 108_hr4588
content: The Act titled "Lower Rio Grande Valley Water Resources Conservation and Improvement Act of 2004" authorizes additional projects and activities under the Lower Rio Grande Water Conservation and Improvement Program. The Lower Rio Grande Valley Water Resources Conservation and Improvement Act of 2000 authorizes additional water conservation and improvement projects in Cameron County, Texas, including projects for Bayview Irrigation District No. 11, Brownsville Irrigation District, and Harlingen Irrigation District No. 1. Total costs for these projects are $1,425,219, $722,100, and to be determined, respectively. The Lower Rio Grande Valley Water Resources Conservation and Improvement Act of 2000 authorizes water conservation and improvement projects in Cameron County, Texas. Projects include those for various irrigation districts with costs identified in engineering reports. The Lower Rio Grande Valley Water Resources Conservation and Improvement Act of 2000 authorizes water conservation and improvement projects in Cameron County, Texas. Projects for irrigation districts in Hidalgo and Willacy Counties, Texas, include water conservation and improvement projects at costs ranging from $5,312,475 to $8,929,152 as identified in engineering reports. In 2004, water conservation and improvement projects were identified in various irrigation districts in Hidalgo County, Texas, at costs ranging from $2,251,480 to $4,609,000. In 2004, water conservation and improvement projects were identified in irrigation districts in Hudspeth County, El Paso County, and Hidalgo County, Texas, with costs ranging from $500,000 to $10,500,000 as per engineering reports by Axiom-Blair Engineering. In Hidalgo County, Texas, water conservation and improvement projects were identified in engineering reports by different firms at varying costs. The projects included in the reports ranged from $2,500,000 to $6,067,021. The Secretary may include activities to conserve water or improve supply in projects conducted under subsection (a), such as replacing irrigation canals with pipelines, lining canals, installing measurement systems, renovating pumping plants, and other water conservation activities. Amounts for projects in subsection (a) can be transferred for use in other projects. The Secretary may transfer and use up to 10 percent for another project under subsection (a). SEC. 3. Reauthorization of appropriations for Lower Rio Grande construction includes funding for specific projects outlined in subsections (a) and (b).
